title: Walking With Saint James: 31 Meditations for Pilgrims on the Camino de Santiago
description: An ancient pilgrimage, a weary sojourner, and an incredible and sacred journey through endless fields of stars. For the last thousand years, pilgrims have journeyed through Spain on the Camino de Santiago , a 500-mile pilgrimage to the Cathedral of Santiago de Compostela . Legend holds that James, the Apostle of Jesus, rests in a crypt beneath the old cathedral. Walking the dusty plains of the Meseta Central , through the shady forests of pine and eucalyptus, trekking across the windy ridgetops of the Cantábrian Mountain Range , and traversing endless fields of stars , we embark on a spiritual quest to explore the writings of Saint James. And as we walk we make friends and discover that our faith in God is evolving, growing ever deeper! In his vital, sacred, inspiring travelogue, Zebulun Mattos sets out on a spiritual and cultural odyssey that offers contemplative prayers, quiet inspiration, and lasting hope. Each devotional includes glimpses of the pilgrim's journey, tales of knights and nobles, historical anecdotes, and depictions of ecology and anthropology encountered along the way.
